about_me.title: About me
about_me.paragraph:
Hello, my name is Jakub Sokol. I am an IT student from the Czech Republic with a deep passion for technology that began in my childhood. From an early age, I was captivated by computers and the innovations they made possible, whether it was exploring how they worked, learning new software, or immersing myself in the world of gaming. Over time, this fascination grew into a dedicated pursuit of knowledge about the inner workings of technology, particularly games.
As I delved deeper into the mechanics behind gaming how games are designed, programmed, and brought to life I realized that creating games isn't just a career aspiration but a personal dream of mine. I aim to combine my technical skills with my creativity to craft experiences that entertain, inspire, and connect people around the world. My journey as an IT student is just the beginning, and I‚Äôm eager to continue learning, innovating, and eventually bringing my vision of developing games to reality.

acnod.description: Acnod was a project me and my friend <link href='https://skymmel.eu' rel='noreferrer' target='_blank'}>Vojtƒõch Skyba</link> were working on. It was a freelance website on which we offered website development services.

nagy3d.description: This website is for a company named Nagy 3D that offers 3D printing and scanning in the northwestern region of the Czech Republic. It offers a minimalistic and clean look so the user can have a good experience.

slenderman.description: A short horror game clone built in Unreal Engine 5. Original game: Slender: The Eight Pages by Parsec Productions. It features page collection, basic enemy AI, and a full win/lose loop. Focused on learning C++, AI behavior and completing a playable game.

intro.p1: A small horror game project inspired by Slender: The Eight Pages, built in Unreal Engine 5.
intro.p2: This project was for me to learn and finish developing a playable game in UE5. Not all planned features were implemented as I focused on finishing a playable version.

learned.title: üí° What I Learned
items: Building a full gameplay loop from start to finish
Managing project scope and avoiding perfectionism
Using C++ to handle AI and interaction logic
Setting up pause/lose/win widgets in UE5
